name: OperationDefinition
description: A formal computable definition of an operation (on the RESTful interface) or a named query (using the search interaction).

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: url
elements.short: Canonical identifier for this operation definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
elements.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this operation definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this operation definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the operation definition is stored on different servers.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: version
elements.short: Business version of the operation definition
elements.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the operation definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the operation definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: name
elements.short: Name for this operation definition (computer friendly)
elements.description: A natural language name identifying the operation definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: title
elements.short: Name for this operation definition (human friendly)
elements.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the operation definition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.description: The status of this operation definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: kind
elements.description: Whether this is an operation or a named query.

binding.description: Whether an operation is a normal operation or a query.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: experimental
elements.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
elements.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this operation definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: date
elements.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the operation definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the operation definition changes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: publisher
elements.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
elements.description: The name of the organization or individual that published the operation definition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contact
elements.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.short: Natural language description of the operation definition
elements.description: A free text natural language description of the operation definition from a consumer's perspective.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: useContext
elements.short: The context that the content is intended to support
elements.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate operation definition instances.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: jurisdiction
elements.short: Intended jurisdiction for operation definition (if applicable)
elements.description: A legal or geographic region in which the operation definition is intended to be used.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: purpose
elements.short: Why this operation definition is defined
elements.description: Explanation of why this operation definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: affectsState
elements.short: Whether content is changed by the operation
elements.description: Whether the operation affects state. Side effects such as producing audit trail entries do not count as 'affecting  state'.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: code
elements.short: Name used to invoke the operation
elements.description: The name used to invoke the operation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: comment
elements.description: Additional information about how to use this operation or named query.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: base
elements.short: Marks this as a profile of the base
elements.description: Indicates that this operation definition is a constraining profile on the base.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: resource
elements.description: The types on which this operation can be executed.

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: system
elements.description: Indicates whether this operation or named query can be invoked at the system level (e.g. without needing to choose a resource type for the context).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.description: Indicates whether this operation or named query can be invoked at the resource type level for any given resource type level (e.g. without needing to choose a specific resource id for the context).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: instance
elements.description: Indicates whether this operation can be invoked on a particular instance of one of the given types.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: inputProfile
elements.description: Additional validation information for the in parameters - a single profile that covers all the parameters. The profile is a constraint on the parameters resource as a whole.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: outputProfile
elements.description: Additional validation information for the out parameters - a single profile that covers all the parameters. The profile is a constraint on the parameters resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: parameter
elements.description: The parameters for the operation/query.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Either a type must be provided, or parts
A search type can only be specified for parameters of type string
A targetProfile can only be specified for parameters of type Reference or Canonical

elements.name: id
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: name
elements.short: Name in Parameters.parameter.name or in URL
elements.description: The name of used to identify the parameter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: use
elements.description: Whether this is an input or an output parameter.

binding.description: Whether an operation parameter is an input or an output parameter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: min
elements.description: The minimum number of times this parameter SHALL appear in the request or response.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: max
elements.description: The maximum number of times this element is permitted to appear in the request or response.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: documentation
elements.description: Describes the meaning or use of this parameter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.description: The type for this parameter.

binding.description: A list of all the concrete types defined in this version of the FHIR specification - Abstract Types, Data Types and Resource Types.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: targetProfile
elements.short: If type is Reference | canonical, allowed targets
elements.description: Used when the type is "Reference" or "canonical", and identifies a profile structure or implementation Guide that applies to the target of the reference this parameter refers to. If any profiles are specified, then the content must conform to at least one of them. The URL can be a local reference - to a contained StructureDefinition, or a reference to another StructureDefinition or Implementation Guide by a canonical URL. When an implementation guide is specified, the target resource SHALL conform to at least one profile defined in the implementation guide.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: searchType
elements.short: number | date | string | token | reference | composite | quantity | uri | special
elements.description: How the parameter is understood as a search parameter. This is only used if the parameter type is 'string'.

binding.description: Data types allowed to be used for search parameters.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: binding
elements.short: ValueSet details if this is coded
elements.description: Binds to a value set if this parameter is coded (code, Coding, CodeableConcept).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: strength
elements.description: Indicates the degree of conformance expectations associated with this binding - that is, the degree to which the provided value set must be adhered to in the instances.

binding.description: Indication of the degree of conformance expectations associated with a binding.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: valueSet
elements.description: Points to the value set or external definition (e.g. implicit value set) that identifies the set of codes to be used.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: referencedFrom
elements.description: Identifies other resource parameters within the operation invocation that are expected to resolve to this resource.

elements.name: source
elements.description: The name of the parameter or dot-separated path of parameter names pointing to the resource parameter that is expected to contain a reference to this resource.

elements.name: sourceId

elements.name: overload
elements.short: Define overloaded variants for when  generating code
elements.description: Defines an appropriate combination of parameters to use when invoking this operation, to help code generators when generating overloaded parameter sets for this operation.
